intro: Diodia assurgens, commonly known as the creeping daisy or swamp daisy, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a low-growing perennial herb with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters called cymes. It thrives in wet or marshy habitats and is often found in swampy areas along riverbanks. Diodia assurgens is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
